alert.note: Alert for Fergus (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 3:31PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Fergus County through 400 PM MDT... At 330 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Lewistown, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail, along with brief heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Heath and Forestgrove. This includes Highway 200 between mile markers 92 and 105. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall may lead to localized flooding of streets, small creeks, and low-lying areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
